name: The Westin Harbour Castle

reviews.text: We just returned yesterday from a trip to Toronto. We had a very comfortable stay at the Westin Harbour Castle for 5 nights. We got a good rate of $75 US from Hotwire. The room was large, clean, wonderful bed and linens. The bathroom was large with great towels. We were on the penthouse floor in the south tower with a good view of Lake Ontario. I noticed that on lower floors it looked like the carpeting and doors had been replaced and updated. The furniture and carpets were a little tired but not enough to affect our stay. We had a coffee maker and were furnished with Starbucks coffee. Our only criticism is that we came back to the room about 2 p.m on our last day and the room still had not been made up. Soon after we returned housekeeping called to ask when they could clean. They came immediately and we sat in the lobby. We found the location excellent. It was an easy walk to Union Station, the St. Lawrence Market and other downtown sites and good restaurants. We are good walkers and walked almost all over for 5 days. The trolley came to within a block of the hotel before going underground to return to Union Station. The lobby is spacious and very attractive, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. And there were free apples in the lobby in the afternoon!
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay

reviews.text: Frankly speaking, I could not find anything lacking in the hotel at all!
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: Had booked through hotwire and was still treated very well! A good hotel in a good location!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!
Westin: Ok
reviews.text: The only problm could be to the smokers as the entire hotel is non smoking with no smoking rooms at all!
This was a wonderful hotel. The bed was comfy, huge plasma tv, room was clean and updated and great location. Only drawback was that the internet cost $10/day.
reviews.title: Just average

reviews.text: We stayed for only one night. We got the romantic package which included sparkling wine and strawberries. It was very nice. The room was a little small but we had a balcony and faced right onto the water, very lovely.
reviews.title: Lovely place...

reviews.text: The pool was great, the hot tub was scalding, no one could go in it, so I mentioned to the staff about the heat, and they fixed it within minutes. The staff was very friendly and very attentive. The valet parking is quite costly $30, but that's quite common when you are staying downtown. We had breakfast delivered in our room very promptly. We had a great time.
reviews.title: Very Substandard for a Westin Property

reviews.text: I reserved 3 rooms at the Westin Harbour Castle April 8, 2006. I asked for double beds in each room. We received a king sized bed in each room. We had it switched with no problem, but it was just very time consuming and annoying. Upon arriving at the hotel I was called a "liar" by one of the valet attendants. He asked me how I was doing as I was taking the luggage out of my trunk, and I said fine. As I went to grab a cart for our luggage, he GRABBED me by my arm and told me not to touch the cart without asking. We then got into a verbal confrontation. Nice way to start a vacation. Very unprofessional. Once we arrived in our rooms, we found them clean, but very small. The beds were small but comfortable. The most impressive part of this hotel is the lobby. Valet parking was a little pricy, 30 dollars, and I paid cash for 2 vehicles. Good thing I kept the receipt, because upon checking out, the woman in charge of the valet told me that I hadn't paid. So this is when verbal confrontation number two happened. After producing my receipt, she just looked at me and then said, "well we have no record of it, but I guess you did pay if that's what this says". What kind of comment is this? Does she think I made a counterfeit receipt on Westin stationary? Unbelievable. How is it acceptable for ANY hotel to have their employees talk to customers this way. At Westin's in the past, I have had nothing but excellent service. This is definitely not what to expect at the Westin Harbour Castle. I would highly recommend staying at one of the DOZENS of hotels in close proximity with better rooms, service and amenities. I will not be staying at the Westin Harbour Castle in the future. Ever. I do not enjoy arguing with hotel staff when I travel.
reviews.title: A fine space for a fine stay

reviews.text: This is the second time we have stayed at this location, and this time we got lucky with a very nice room. We had a full view of the lake even though we had booked on Priceline, and our bed was exceptionally comfortable. The cable channels are limited and our remote control device didn't work. The location requires a short walk for things to do in Toronto. All the attendants in the hotel, however, are helpful. A massage at the spa was not a pleasant experience although a dip in the pool was nice. Starbucks coffee in the room was a bonus. We would definitely return to the hotel again.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay at the Westin!
Unauthorized Charges
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from our second visit to the Westin within the past year. We got a great $76 rate through Hotwire.

Westin was a great hotel. Located right on the harbour front, we had a room that overlooked the lake. It was very nice and clean. Also walking distance to CN tower and the ferry to the islands goes straight from the bottom of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: I checked into the hotel on Canada Day, a day where there was a lot of activity outside of the hotel. I thought the hotel seemed a little loud - I could hear people in the room next to me, in the hallways, and I heard a dog barking. I could also hear the fireworks outside... not a nusiance but I was very tired from my flight. I was settling in to my bed and heard an announcement over the loudspeaker that there was an emergency in the hotel and to not leave my room. This announcement came on several more times and finally a few hours later and well into the night I called the front reception to find out what was going on since I was frightened and tired. I was told basic information and only found out what happened the next day in the news. Regardless, the point of the story is that the hotel NEVER told me that it was safe to leave my room or ever even acknowledged what happend or tried to compensate me in any way. I did leave a detailed comment card - still no reply from Westin or Starwood. I am sure if I complained or told them that I would have changed hotels that they would have reacted differently but I was trying to give them the benefit of the doubt.
reviews.title: Awful Experience- Okay Hotel

reviews.text: Otherwise, I had a great view, an older room that needed some ductwork fixed up, liked the apples at the reception, the main part of the hotel needs sprucing up, the gym was excellent for a hotel, but I would be reluctant to stay there again. I also agree with other posters that the area is not ideal for walking to nearby shops or dining.
reviews.title: Harbour Castle -a nice stay

reviews.text: Booked thru Priceline. Got a great rate. Location is spectacular

reviews.title: Nice Hotel, a bit overpriced
Loved the Spa
reviews.text: Wonderful hotel with fabulous views and all the luxuries. Made full use of the spa (I'm a spa junkie) and had one of the best body wraps ever. Not cheap but worth the price.

reviews.title: Downtown Toronto
reviews.text: Good location for downtown activities, room was one that was not renovated yet, apparently they are in the process of renovating all rooms. Room was clean, good coffee (Starbucks) for in room coffee maker, we were cold though, furnace took a long time to warm the room and morning shower was COLD. Expensive for what you get.
Great Japanese restaurant in the plaza directly across the street, go to the crosswalk, cross over and take the path between the buildings, very good sushi and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Don't stay here

reviews.text: We moved rooms three times before we got a clean one. The newly furbished rooms had a really poor finish - nails on floor, plaster splashed on tiles, paint on carpet. It would have been really stylish otherwise. Not what we expected from a Westin. Location is quiet, lake or city views. If you get a really good deal, ie less than $100, then you could consider it, but if you're expecting quality, you'll be disappointed.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: Very good service, view from hotel is amazing and location is right on the waterfront - room ok but some parts of hotel could do with updating
reviews.title: Perfect, especially if you're into hockey

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle for a few days right before New Year's Eve. The hotel has a great pool area and locker room, and the cafe price for coffee was really reasonable considering what most hotels charge.
reviews.title: Nice place, location OK

reviews.text: Our king size bedroom in the North Tower was very nice with the flat screen TV and comfortable bed, but the tub and shower were just OK. We had a view of the apartments across from the hotel, and a bit of a view of the lake and city, so nothing spectacular. But the best thing about the room was it was quiet!
reviews.title: A great stay

reviews.text: The location was OK, a bit out of the way from a lot of the major attactions of Toronto, but not too far from the transit car, so it was not so bad, it would be a great place to stay in the summer I bet.
reviews.title: No complaints about the Westin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay again for sure, if I got a good rate again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Service needs improvement

reviews.text: My husband & I with our two children, ages 12 & 15, spent the first weekend in December at the Westin for a mini-getaway. Booked thru Priceline for $80/night. We thought the location was fine and walked to the CN Tower, Hockey Hall of Fame, Hard Rock Cafe, etc. and thought it was fine. Our room was newly renovated and had a beautiful view. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Fine for Business Travel

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights at $99 USD per night with a lakefront view. I don't know if the room I was in was renovated or not, but it was nice and clean. Service was great. They have an indoor pool and hot tub open until 11:00 each night, but they were usually packed with kids. They apparently have parking available, but I parked at the public lot next door ($15CDN per weekday, $10CDN per weekend day). That turned out to be cheaper than the hotel rate, but I don't think the public lot allows in-and-out privileges. It doesn't matter anyways -- the hotel is within blocks of several subway stations and is at the foot of Yonge Street. I'd definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Great location
disappointing
reviews.text: Only 1 towel was provided for 2 people. We requested an add'l towel to be brought up right away so that we could shower and make our dinner reservation. Couldn't wait and dried off with a hand towel -- towel was delivered about 45 minutes later!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Someone set off the fire alarm went off at 4:30am so we trudged dutifully down 26 flights of stairs. Apparently on weekends this is the "norm." Received no refills of water bottles or coffee on the 2nd day of our stay.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with great vies

reviews.text: Reception was also understaffed; parking a disaster; you almost get run over by taxis or guests as you try to enter/exit the hotel.

reviews.title: You cant beat Westin Service and Quality

reviews.text: Nothing to say other than to compliment the hotel & staff on a great visit. Paula in the Business Centre & Sue, the concierge were particularly helpful. The renovated rooms are very comfortable with large flat screen TV, safe & mini bar. Pool & gym are clean & a good size.
reviews.title: The new rooms are awesome.
Great room, great price, great staff
reviews.text: We've used the Courtyard Marriott before & it's good but this is a cut above. If anyone was to come in the summer then I'd definitely recommend this hotel. Access to the Islands couldn't be easier, it's a short walk to Union Station, Air Canada & CN Tower. The Eaton Centre is about 15-20min walk, the best way to explore a city.
A taxi from the hotel to Pearson is a flat $46 + tip & takes about 30min, we left the hotel before 4pm & didn't encounter any hold ups but the roads were getting busier.
reviews.title: Average/Decent Business Hotel

likes.liked: — Plasma TV in the renovated rooms
likes.disliked: — Overpriced parking, unrenovated rooms are below average.

reviews.title: Excellent even under renovations
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Westin and was concerned about noise after reading a review on here. The renovations will soon be complete and they only do renovations between 9 and 5.

reviews.title: Excellent location
reviews.text: There was no noise during my stay at all. The views were fantastic( you could see not only the harbour but the sky dome and the air canada centre as well) and the hotel was so central. A walk away from everything. If there was a problem the heavenly beds may have made me forget about it..... so comfy. Last but not least the facilities great as well. Very clean and many options.( pool, steam room, sauna, RBK workout etc) Bring your tennis raquet if you play a quality court on the 5th floor roof over looking the edge very cool.

reviews.title: stay away until refurbishment is complete!
reviews.text: A little pricey for the rooms as a whole but worth it. The only thing I would reccomend is eating elsewhere. Lots of places close and $21 for a ceaser salad a little out of wak.

reviews.title: Ask for a renovated room
reviews.text: Just got back from a 2 night stay at the Harbour Castle, overall the hotel and staff are quite nice, but does have its problems in certain areas.

reviews.title: Great Honeymoon spot!
reviews.text: We checked in later in the evening (9pm on Friday) without a problem, the Front Desk staff were excellent, the room was a semi lakeview, looking east on the 35th floor. Upon entering the room we both immediatly noted how the room was warmer than the hallway even though the room Air Conditioning was set to cold and the blow set to high, we decided to give the AC a chance to see if there would be any change. A short time later I was about to sit down to do some work on my laptop only to find very prominent stains all over the chair, as well as other dried solid substances (don't even want to venture a guess at what it could have been). Other negative points of this room that didn't bother much, but should be mentioned include a non-functional light switch, dirty light switches and somewhat dated/well used furniture.

reviews.title: Great Place to Stay (Unless You're Paying Full Price!)
reviews.text: The room was OK, nothing spectacular (I'm assuming it was a pre-renovation room because it was a regular TV, not flat-screen like others have indicated). My only complaint was that the air-conditioning could have been a bit stronger. Location was fine! Right on Lake Ontario (I had a nice view of the lake from my room). True, it's about 3-4 blocks to get to Union Station if you want to take the subway or train, but Toronto is a walker's city. Toronto's transit system is very easy to use, so once you get to Union Station you can get almost anywhere. And, there was always a line of cabs right in front of the hotel. There were two places to get breakfast or a quick bite to eat right across the street, and a convenience store a block or so up the street that was open 24 hours. Again, 3-4 blocks away were plenty of restaurant choices, plus the subway if you wanted to head into a different part of the city. Parking throughout Toronto is horrible, although definitely a bit pricier at the Westin (which was fine for me -- I actually returned the rental car that I had gotten early since I really didn't need it to get around the city). I would never pay the $400+ listed on the door, but for $89 a night on Priceline, this place couldn't be beat!

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: We stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle for 3 nights at the end of a two week holiday in Ontario. The hotel is situated, as the name suggests, on the waterfront and we upgraded to get a newly refurbished room with a view of the harbour. For what we paid for the room ($270 a night) I don't think the hotel is marvellous value for money however the nearby harbour area is very pleasant at all times of the day. Staff in the hotel were friendly and knowledgeable - there was nothing that was too much trouble for them. The room we had was not the biggest but was adequate for our needs and the view was great. The leisure facilities are also good with an indoor pool, tennis courts and a decent gym. I would recommend the hotel for others and although there is refurbishment work taking place - we certainly didn't notice anything untoward during our stay. However, this may be because we didn't want to take any chances and paid extra for the refurbished room.

reviews.title: A pleasant enough stay, nothing special.
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in June 2006, as it was the venue for a conference I was attending. As far as hotel conference venues go, it was above average in terms of amenities, audiovisual etc.

reviews.title: Stayed in older and renovated rooms, great gym
reviews.text: As a hotel, it was fine, but nothing special. My initial room reeked of cigarette smoke to the extent that I was compelled to walk straight back to the lobby to change rooms, which they did expeditiously. A colleague of mine had an identical experience. My room was clean and well equipped, but a little tired around the edges and looking like it wouldn't be too long before a refit became urgent. In fact this could be said of the hotel in general.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: The "Heavenly bed" was fine, but not up to the standard of those at the Westin Bayshore in Vancouver, where I have also stayed.

Stayed with 2 teenagers and the room seemed very small after just one night!! Great location right by the ferry port that takes you over to the tranquil Islands and the harbour front that was quiet at the time we went but I believe wakes up in spring.Staff V helpful, we had a problem with noisy neighbours partying til 3am! and they sorted it immediately and then checked the next day to make sure it was still OK.Convenient walking distance to other attractions. The kids enjoyed the pool over all the other hotels we visited on our trip.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: Everything was wonderful during our stay here. On arrival, there were plenty of staff who were willing to help with the luggage. If you're walking into the hotel, I would recommend taking the stairs just beside of the main hotel entrance. There is another door there and a separate set of stairs. The car entrance is not really designed for travellers on foot. Entering the hotel, by foot, with luggage is definitely a pain.
reviews.title: Relaxing Weekend At The Westin Harbour Castle!

reviews.text: We stayed in a corner room. This included a partial view of the lake, a view of the CN Tower, and a partial view of the skyscrapers. I have included a few photos of the view. Unfortunately, the view of the CN Tower did not turn out. We sat and watched the boats sail up and down the harbour.
reviews.title: Fair Stay for a Conference

reviews.text: The room was very clean. The bathtub was really comfortable. They provide a rolled towel, so that you can relax and rest your head while soaking. The shower was the usual Westin Heavenly Shower with message or spray features. The bed was a soft heavenly bed with plenty of pillows. She loved the bed.
reviews.title: Nice Beds

reviews.text: We ordered room service all weekend, and the food was delicious. The quality was above every day restaurant food. I found that it was delivered quickly, and that it was still very hot.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: I booked this hotel through Hotwire for $67 per night, but got worried after reading some not-so-great reviews here. Much to my delight, the hotel was awesome! Thank you thank you thank you Hotwire! Yes, we paid $17 per day for an uncovered parking lot that was a block and a half away, but it was an easy walk. Yes, we had to walk under the Expressway to get downtown, but again, it was an easy walk. If it got to be really late, we took an inexpensive (less than $10) cab ride back to the hotel.
reviews.title: Absolutely LOVED the Westin Castle Harbour!

reviews.text: We walked all over the city...to the Princess of Wales Theatre to see "Lord of the Rings", to St.Lawrence Market for the recommended peameal bacon sandwich (yummy, by the way...everyone should try it...the market is not open on Sunday's & Monday's by the way)to name a couple places. If you like burgers, on Adelaide St. is a wonderful new place called Hal Burger that offers a variety of types of burgers, plus they make their own condiments!
reviews.title: Terrible stay

description: Welcome to The Westin Harbour Castle, Toronto. Our downtown Toronto hotel is located on the vibrant waterfront of Lake Ontario, where you can enjoy Toronto's seasonal events.
